reviews.review_msg: Basil is a nice dude and he's course is very straight forward and simple.  Easy class and nice prof. what more do you want?

EASIEST econ course/prof I have ever had. Studied like 4 hours for midterm and aced it. Questions were just definitions, very surface level basic stuff. Definitely needed to read the textbook in order to understand the examples he was using, dull lecture but worth the GPA boost! Selected topic was Law and Econ, textbook was free online. VERY TRUE

EASIEST econ course/prof I have ever had. Studied like 4 hours for midterm and aced it. Questions were just definitions, very surface level basic stuff. Definitely needed to read the textbook in order to understand the examples he was using, dull lecture but worth the GPA boost! Selected topic was Law and Economics, textbook was free online

Krishna assigns very long papers as reading material, but the subject matter is pretty interesting. The quizzes are one question each and essentially free marks if you read the material. If you can explain each the assigned content of each lecture in a page or two, you can ace the midterm and final. He's also pretty funny.
really interesting and funny prof, tries to involve the class in discussions. LOTS to read but if you keep up and participate in class youll love it. My favorite prof and course at SFU

For Econ 383 inequality course, make sure to do the readings, make notes from each one, and study your notes. You'll get an A easy. Very knowledgable teacher, has a lot of impressive work he's done, and experience. Also passionate about econ and has a sense of humour :)
He is really good at teaching.

He is a tough grader. However, if you are interested in the course and ready to learn, he is a great option. He is knowledgeable in experimental economics,  knows the material very well and can be inspirational in experimental design. Never expect to sleep the course over and simply get a pass. Overall, he is one of my favourite!

He is really nice and helpful and he explains the materials quite clearly. The materials discussed in class are not very helpful for the project which determines your final score. If you are interested in the topic, you can really learn something from the course.

In general, he is not a bed person. However, he doesn't know how to grade fairly. He was picking about the grammar mistake and sentence structure on the group paper. As a ECON class, that's kinna silly. Also, he lack of the experience to tech in SFU since he was a fresh noob while I taking the class.
Nice guy, very willing to help.
This course is the easiest course of all 300 level. Pay attention on lecture notes.

Thorough notes, clear applications of theories learned in class. Best of all, on the exam questions, he makes all assumptions and conditions explicitly stated, so you know exactly what he's asking, unlike many other sfu econ profs. Only qualm is he needs to get better control over the class.
Nice prof but need to improve on his teaching style. Thorough notes but only if you can read his writing..mt and final was more application of the stuff learnt..ie. scenario based

What a disaster: I am failing an special topic course. I got an A in ECON 381, a similar course, but this prof writes tricky exams while only teaching us basics in lectures. Moreover, the textbook does not allow us to think at advanced levels to prepare us. He has a wonderful wardrobe.
Be prepared to copy a lot of notes during his class. His handwriting his horrendous and he doesn't teach very well. As well, his midterms are quite tricky. Though he does dress quite decent.

I had him for 302 as well and both times his class was VERY straightforward to do well in.  Exams are essentially pure application of the logic taught in class (or in the text).  Goes over examples very slowly and clearly, I have no idea how the averages are always fairly low.  Finished with an A+ in this class and in 302; very much do-able.
He is nice person but not a very good teacher. His lesson is not really helpful and his class is a little confusing. I studied this course by reading textbook and attending tutorials.
A nice teacher and an interesting course.
good guy but hard course

The difficulty is like this: assignments>midterm>final. His assignment had question that he hadn't taught yet at that moment. I wondered how he expected his students to finish that... however, final was quite easy. I got a B+ afterall.
Is sometimes funny

I agree with most of the comments, Dr. Monte is a smart guy but unable to effectively commuicate course material. Yale grad or not he needs to understand that hes a prof who needs to teach the material to others. Avoid at all costs. Too young to be teaching.

He just graduated out of Yale, so I guess he is still in his "PhD" mode. The material is easy, but he make it so HARD (with math). If you want to learn econ more in depth, take him.. he will make you think with a lot of MATH. Also, beware.. his handwriting is horrible.. and LOTS OF HOMEWORK! =S

Thanks to Prof. Barkin, I got an Ace in her course and beware of Environmental Economics. Thus, studying how humans should deal with the environment has been a part of my work. I still appreciate Barkin's caring replies and objective ratings in the course. Her lectures inspired me.

So, mandatory quizzes every class was a pain. The course was mindboggling boring and easy -- it shouldn't be an upper-year elective. However, the prof treats it like it's econ 201. If that's your cup of tea, fair. It was painful. I can't recommend taking electives with Gulriz. However, I think Gulriz may be a good ECON 201 prof.

she will repeat herself a lot in the lectures. the lecture organization is confusing. it is impossible to follow her pace. expected to do the assignment on your own because she does not teach those concepts in lectures. she will go on and on about nonsense for the entire 3 hours of class time. also very rude when students asking her questions.

Maybe better teaching other classes but so far the experience in 383 has been complete garbage. Avoid if you can and take a different econ elective. runs the class like 201 or 302 even though its an elective and did not make any accomdations/change for online learning. Completely coasting just collecting a paycheque.

This Prof is bad, not only as a teacher, but as a communicator. She is impatient and stubborn. She cuts you off in conversations. She does not listen to you. In office hours, she often complains how tired she is. No wonder she gets to her age without achieving anything other than being a sessional instructor at SFU.

All the positive reviews are fake. This is probably the most out of touch prof Ive ever had and we just started the course. Running a 3rd year Econ elective like its a PhD course at Harvard. Zero consideration for course accessibility. Course itself is fine but prof demands attendance but cant deliver the lecture properly.
JUST PAINFUL TAKING HER COURSE. BETTER TO READ THE TEXTBOOK AND LEARN BY YOURSELF.
Terrible teaching, keep speaking around 3 hour. Very unclear explaination, and hard assignments. The lecture is many many words, and hard to understand.

I would recommend you study on your own instead of attending her lecture. Easily confuse you and her lecture is unorganized as well as her explanation is vague. She is very approachable but even office hour she would talk for nonsense. Compare to other economic profs (even with more harder course), their explanations are way better than hers.
She is good at making the easiest things hardest to understand. Never take her class again. Thanks for giving me this horrible experience in SFU.
Horrible teaching, speaking with no intonation, no time to take notes, and weird method to take attendance. Will definitely not take her class again.
Bad preparations before class. dont even know what shes teaching in the class Will not take her class again

Worst prof ever.... never provide enough time for students to jot down the notes. her lectures are so unorganised and terrible. She keeps taking for almost two hours without a break( she never breathe). would not recommend others to take her class.
her midterm was fair but her final was so hard even i had put a lot effort on it. her lecture also not clear at all and her accent so hard to understand

his first semester at SFU. he does not just teach you boring theoritical concepets but gives you tons of real life interesting examples. you can actually learn stuff if you attend lectures! some application problems on the final. make sure you know the material conprehensively to ace the final.
Study his notes. The midterm was easy, final was a little harder but the questions were just recall the discussions from the lecture.  overall recommended.
Great teacher, you will understand before he moves on even if it throws off the schedule by a week! he's highly interested in the material and it really shows, uses the textbook and notes!

The class is pretty easy the material is basic first year econ. The problem sets are very easy and just based on the class notes. The midterm was very east but the final was slightly harder but still fair.
notes are too long and, confused. Midterm and Final are all essay question. Need to memorize lecture notes.

Lectures were not that interesting but very helpful. Hints on exam questions are given. Material and exams were not difficult but required some real world knowledge. Never did any readings. Good GPA booster.

He is a nice person and he makes relatively easier midterm. Textbook is useless. But I always attend to his lec, and its useful to attend his lec b/c there are several questions in the midterm are mentioned in his lec.

This prof expects you to read a 30-40 page paper every single week because you will be quizzed on them weekly. The quizzes are worth half of your total grade and they are extremely hard. The wording sometimes screw your thinking up. Best you can do is to read the slides and watch the videos before each quiz. The prof responds to emails fast though.
Terrible

The lecture of this professor is very simple, there is no detailed explanation. The headache is going through 30 or 40 pages of academic papers every week. You have to read the paper carefully, because the quiz is all from inside, and the quiz is very detailed, which takes up half of the total score.
her notes are clear and concise, lots of info.  exams r pretty tricky tho...but she's a good prof.

A very nice prof, she doesn't want you to drop her class, so if you do bad on the MT, she can weight more towards your final.  Exam questions are from in-class lecture, always gives clues for the exam, so you must attend all her lectures!!

Good prof. Trickie exam that can only be overcome by you  attending classs and going over material over and over. To understand the concepts you must go over notes. Once you do, the exams arn't that bad, but you MUST GO OVER HER CLASS NOTES!! No text required. Has that Russian/Central European (shes from ukraine) hottness to her and good accent.

She really cares about her students and how much they learned. She is nice and considerate, but honestly you need some efford for this course. Friendly advise, go to lecture and try to understand the materials the she coverd. No textbook reading required at all
she was still teaching new materials on the LAST DAY OF CLASS. should have cut out some material so there is time for review on material she was unclear on before!!

Her english accent isn't a big problem. It's her unorganized notes that's confusing. Doesn't do any highlighting to show which concept she's writing is important, all notes are the same, like in an essay. Her game trees are confusing. Could draw a more understandable version drawn from Econ302. MTs are tricky. But she is helpful in person.

Very nice and helpful teacher.  Wants everyone to do well.  Tests are fair, but assignments and quizzes somewhat drop your mark because they are graded quite hard (Try to get her as TA, she marks easier) Overall, course is quite easy.  No textbook required.
No Comments

She's new in this sem, so maybe not as professional as the other profs do. But she's very nice in helping students. I am taking her now, and I think she cares about us very much for how understanding on the stuff. She's great. Midterm is fair, the stuff is not hard. Just take it for no regret.  383 offers nxt sem. And by the way, I think she's hot!
